Major task was to assess each program/project, set new objectives, targets, activities, minimize cost, rationalize staff, etc. Extensive field visits were undertaken and external M&E staff was engaged to assess actual situation. In-depth discussions were held with managers and staff of each program for assessment. Both the assessments were compared and resolved. Program/project documents were re-written with new emphasis, objectives and targets and project activities were arranged on the basis of log-frame. Retrenchment was carried out mostly at the top level and new managers and assistant managers were recruited. Massive indiscipline and chaos were averted. Monitoring plan included development of proper and measurable indicators for each project and program to measure progress of program activities.", "Organized the 2004 flood response program in Manikganj district. The flood response program addressed the following: flood damage assessment, people\u2019s requirements, procurement of flood relief materials, delivery of relief materials, liaison with donors, etc. Flood damage assessment was carried out with the help of fresh recruited staff, emphasizing gender, age, income categories of flood victims, actual damages at household/individual level, etc. Challenges faced were resource constraints, pressure from UP Chairmen and members, local elites and political leaders, lack of medical care especially for children, elderly and women, access to toilets, etc. To maintain neutrality, Disaster Relief and Rehabilitation Committees (DRRC) were established along with close liaison with UP, upazila UNO and Police. Coordinate local, regional and national workshops on PRSP.", "Conduct research on membership overlap, employment and impact of BRAC programs at macro level. Both the quantitative and qualitative methods were employed to collect information and data. The study on membership overlap showed the inevitability of membership overlap and recommended for local level coordination of all micro-credit organizations to prevent overlapping. The study on employment showed that proper and productive use of credit generates employment but the generation grows faster when additional inputs are available. BRAC programs not only benefitted the BRAC members but also helped and benefitted other non-BRAC members indirectly in different ways.", "Leading figure in the dissemination of research findings among BRAC managers and staff. Assist project staff in undertaking periodic reviews and baseline surveys. Conduct needs assessment for a number of interventions/projects and proposals. Compile, supervise and edit Annual Report. Coordinate networking activities. Prepare project proposals on thematic issues and areas.", "Main focus of the activities of the organization was Economic development, Education, Health, Orphan sponsorship and disaster mitigation. Major task was to assess each program/project, set new objectives, targets, activities, minimize cost, rationalize staff, etc. Extensive field visits were undertaken and external M&E staff was engaged to assess actual situation. In-depth discussions were held with managers and staff of each program for assessment. Both the assessments were compared and resolved. Program/project documents were re-written with new emphasis, objectives and targets and project activities were arranged on the basis of log-frame. Retrenchment was carried out mostly at the top level and new managers and assistant managers were recruited. Massive indiscipline and chaos were averted. Monitoring was strengthened and a separate M&E unit was eventually established.", "Developed and established a strong M&E unit. M&E was gradually introduced in several projects and programs. From appointment of M&E staff on a temporary basis to appoint staff for longer durations and finally appointment against permanent positions, a separate and independent M&E unit was established.", "Monitoring helped to improve project and program implementation by identifying the lapses and gaps and recommended ways of overcoming the weaknesses and failures. Monitoring plan included development of proper and measurable indicators for each project and program to measure progress of program activities.", "Organized the 2004 flood response program in Manikganj district. The flood response program addressed the following: flood damage assessment, people\u2019s requirements, procurement of flood relief materials, delivery of relief materials, liaison with donors, etc. Flood damage assessment was carried out with the help of fresh recruited staff, emphasizing gender, age, income categories of flood victims, actual damages at household/individual level, etc. Challenges faced were resource constraints, pressure from UP Chairmen and members, local elites and political leaders, lack of medical care especially for children, elderly and women, access to toilets, etc. To maintain neutrality, Disaster Relief and Rehabilitation Committees (DRRC) were established along with close liaison with UP, upazila UNO and Police. Organized distribution of food, non-food, medical, shelter, agricultural inputs, etc. Despite a host of problems faced by the flood relief program, it was successful as major external interferences were avoided, selection of beneficiaries was proper and there was no evidence of irregularity in any activity.", "Conducted evaluation of the Mother & Child Healthcare (MCH) project in Rangpur district. Compared MCH project with the MCH project carried out by RDRS in greater Rangpur districts. MCH was overstaffed and there existed no phase-out plan.", "Prepared a number of project proposals and received funds from donors. The first project to receive funds from the European Commission was on disaster risk reduction. The second project also on disaster risk reduction, received funds from the European Commission. The third project received funds from the UNDP through the government was also on disaster risk reduction using a distinct methodology. The fourth project receiving funds from the European Commission was on the rehabilitation of Rohingya refugees in Cox\u2019s Bazar."]}, {"Time Period": "May 1997 \u2013 September 1999", "Organization": "Proshika", "Location": "Location: Not specified", "Role/Title": "Head of the Policy Research Department", "Responsibilities": ["Supervise a large team of 17 researchers. Coordinate local, regional and national workshops on PRSP.", "Conduct research on membership overlap, employment and impact of BRAC programs at macro level. Both the quantitative and qualitative methods were employed to collect information and data. The study on membership overlap showed the inevitability of membership overlap and recommended for local level coordination of all micro-credit organizations to prevent overlapping. The study on employment showed that proper and productive use of credit generates employment but the generation grows faster when additional inputs are available. BRAC programs not only benefitted the BRAC members but also helped and benefitted other non-BRAC members indirectly in different ways.", "Leading figure in the dissemination of research findings among BRAC managers and staff. In 2000, BRAC organized dissemination conferences in all the major divisional centers of the country. The participants to these conferences were directors, program coordinators, program managers and area managers. The Research & Evaluation Division selected 5-6 studies for dissemination in the conferences. Each of the study was presented using power-point and was subsequently followed by questions and answers. The conferences were successful due to clear presentations of the research findings and proper answers to all the questions raised in the meetings.", "BRAC was responsible for conducting the local, regional and national level consultation meetings of PRSP. The aim of these consultation workshops was to prepare an interim PRSP document. My task was to facilitate the workshops, take notes and prepare reports. Although the National Consultants, Dr. Binayek Sen and Dr. Mustafa K. Mujeri were present in each of the consultation workshops, I facilitated most of the workshops and took notes. Develop and update creative, innovative and effective tools for policy advocacy consistent with research findings.", "Review different types of research \u2013 evaluation and assessment of different public sector programmes and organizations, research on current issues, etc. The review process includes intense assessment of the concept paper, scope of the research, methodology, data collection and data processing plan, outline of the research study, literature review, etc. Presentation and incorporation of feedbacks were made a mandatory step in the process of conducting research.", "Conducted a large-scale research based on a national Household Survey on Corruption in 2010 and advocated reforms in the judicial system. Designed the survey and prepared the questionnaire and checklist for the National Household Survey on Corruption. Organized recruitment of data enumerators and conducted 4-day training. Organized a group of national level experts to review the survey methodology. Supervised data cleaning, editing and entry. Supervised report writing. Organized a round table discussion on 23rd December 2010 and released the findings of the survey. Prepared and developed policy briefs on judiciary and police. The survey created unprecedented publicity and helped to strengthen TIB\u2019s communication and advocacy.", "Conduct an in-depth diagnostic study on the \u201cState of Governance in the Private Universities of Bangladesh\u201d. A survey questionnaire was developed on students and data was collected from 400 students of 10 randomly selected private universities in Dhaka. The study uncovered lack of transparency and accountability of both the government and the private university authorities.", "An international workshop based on experiences of TI chapters of Asia and Africa with participation of the TI Secretariat from Germany was held in Dhaka. The 6-day workshop was held in Dhaka. An international conference on Integrity Pact was held in Dhaka. Developed a project proposal that was submitted to TI-Secretariat", "Design a survey to collect public opinion on amendments to the ACC Law. Prepare a questionnaire for the survey. Data was collected from 36 areas of Bangladesh. Findings of the survey were made public through a press conference. The survey was followed by a series of activities, human chain, cultural events, dissemination of printed materials, etc. The survey was able to put a stop to the process of curbing the powers of the ACC.", "Supervised, organized roundtable workshops for the following studies: Shadow Economy of Bangladesh, National Board of Revenue (NBR), Parliament Watch, Tracking Electoral Commitments, Baseline Survey, Fact Sheet, RTI (Right to Information), Electorate Empowerment and CPI (Corruption Perception Index)", "Organized and supervised publication of the following reports:\n1. National Household Survey on Corruption 2010\n2. Problems of Good Governance (Vol-II)"]}, {"Time Period": "November 2008 \u2013 March 2010", "Organization": "Dhaka Ahsania Mission", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Director-Research", "Responsibilities": ["Supervised a team of 6 researchers. Conduct quantitative and qualitative research \u2013 Baseline Survey, Needs Assessment, Monitoring, Evaluation, Impact Assessment, Process Documentation, Case Studies. Develop proposals. Liaise with donors and the government.", "Supervised research activities of the individual researchers, assisted the researchers in developing the concept papers, tools and research design, recruitment of data collectors, training of data collectors, supervision of field work, data processing, data analysis, reviewing draft reports, power-point presentations", "Supervised a baseline survey on Violence against women and children. Developed methodology, questionnaire, supervised data collection, analysis and data entry. Edited the survey report. Supervised a research monograph on trafficking"]}, {"Time Period": "August 2004 \u2013 November 2008", "Organization": "Islamic Relief Bangladesh", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Program Evaluation and Development Advisor", "Responsibilities": ["Supervise a team of 4 professionals. Prepare final reports to donors for completed projects. Develop monitoring plans and indicators. Conducted project and program evaluations. Assist project staff in undertaking periodic reviews and baseline surveys. Conduct needs assessment for a number of interventions/projects and proposals. Compile, supervise and edit Annual Report. Coordinate networking activities. Prepare project proposals on thematic issues and areas.", "Main focus of the activities of the organization was Economic development, Education, Health, Orphan sponsorship and disaster mitigation. Major task was to assess each program/project, set new objectives, targets, activities, minimize cost, rationalize staff, etc. Extensive field visits were undertaken and external M&E staff was engaged to assess actual situation. In-depth discussions were held with managers and staff of each program for assessment. Both the assessments were compared and resolved. Program/project documents were re-written with new emphasis, objectives and targets and project activities were arranged on the basis of log-frame. Retrenchment was carried out mostly at the top level and new managers and assistant managers were recruited. Massive indiscipline and chaos were averted. Monitoring was strengthened and a separate M&E unit was eventually established.", "Developed and established a strong M&E unit. M&E was gradually introduced in several projects and programs. From appointment of M&E staff on a temporary basis to appoint staff for longer durations and finally appointment against permanent positions, a separate and independent M&E unit was established.\n\nMonitoring helped to improve project and program implementation by identifying the lapses and gaps and recommended ways of overcoming the weaknesses and failures. Monitoring plan included development of proper and measurable indicators for each project and program to measure progress of program activities.", "Organized the 2004 flood response program in Manikganj district. The flood response program addressed the following: flood damage assessment, people\u2019s requirements, procurement of flood relief materials, delivery of relief materials, liaison with donors, etc. Flood damage assessment was carried out with the help of fresh recruited staff, emphasizing gender, age, income categories of flood victims, actual damages at household/individual level, etc. Challenges faced were resource constraints, pressure from UP Chairmen and members, local elites and political leaders, lack of medical care especially for children, elderly and women, access to toilets, etc. To maintain neutrality, Disaster Relief and Rehabilitation Committees (DRRC) were established along with close liaison with UP, upazila UNO and Police. Organized distribution of food, non-food, medical, shelter, agricultural inputs, etc. Despite a host of problems faced by the flood relief program, it was successful as major external interferences were avoided, selection of beneficiaries was proper and there was no evidence of irregularity in any activity.", "Conducted evaluation of the Mother & Child Healthcare (MCH) project in Rangpur district. Compared MCH project with the MCH project carried out by RDRS in greater Rangpur districts. MCH was overstaffed and there existed no phase-out plan.", "Prepared a number of project proposals and received funds from donors. The first project to receive funds from the European Commission was on disaster risk reduction. The second project also on disaster risk reduction, received funds from the European Commission. The third project received funds from the UNDP through the government was also on disaster risk reduction using a distinct methodology. The fourth project receiving funds from the European Commission was on the rehabilitation of Rohingya refugees in Cox\u2019s Bazar."]}, {"Time Period": "May 2002 \u2013 July 2004", "Organization": "Practical Action Bangladesh", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Socio Economist", "Responsibilities": ["Implement activities, results and objectives of the Consensus Building process in charland. Develop dissemination plans and carry out awareness raising activities. Recruit researchers at field-level. Develop regular reporting system. Develop capacity of poor people to access common property resources through Participatory Action Plan Development. Maintain regular correspondence with the HQ in UK and submit reports to DFID. Develop monitoring plans for the various projects of the organization. Conduct impact assessments on projects and interventions.", "Initiated dissemination activities in char areas and Dhaka through individual contacts, group meetings, public seminars and distribution of printed materials and literature. Popular leaflets, phamplets, brochures and booklets were prepared and widely distributed. In order to raise the confidence of the people, the project initiated different activities aiming at increasing income of the people. The project promoted income earning activities in charland. Promoted maize production. Initiated campaign for goat rearing. Provided training to women for tailoring and cloth-stitching. Organized discussions on Participatory Action Plan Development (PAPD). In the final stage, organized PAPD and achieved local-level consensus between the landless and marginal farmers and the powerful landowners on joint cultivation and use of water-body in the area.", "Responsible for evaluating and developing the regional networks for development of Small & Medium Enterprises (SME). The network helped to unite the local NGOs to build their capacity and develop small business.", "Contributed in implementing activities, results and objectives of the project \u201cEnhancing Food Production in Greater Faridpur district\u201d. Collected and assessed reports from the staff in-charge of production centers in different production points of the project in greater Faridpur district. Based on these written reports, organized systematic field visits and conducted extensive discussions and interviews with project staff, beneficiaries, officials of related government agencies and the people. Emphasized participation and use of simple and innovative technology. Prepared a simple but elaborate monitoring plan for the project. Within a short-time the project was able to achieve most of the targets of the project."]}, {"Time Period": "October 1999 \u2013 April 2002", "Organization": "BRAC", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Research Economist", "Responsibilities": ["Conduct research on BRAC programs. Present research findings in meetings and conferences. Conduct research focusing on impact assessment of selected BRAC programs. Participate in networking and advocacy activities. Coordinate local, regional and national workshops on PRSP.", "Conduct research on membership overlap, employment and impact of BRAC programs at macro level. Both the quantitative and qualitative methods were employed to collect information and data. The study on membership overlap showed the inevitability of membership overlap and recommended for local level coordination of all micro-credit organizations to prevent overlapping. The study on employment showed that proper and productive use of credit generates employment but the generation grows faster when additional inputs are available. BRAC programs not only benefitted the BRAC members but also helped and benefitted other non-BRAC members indirectly in different ways.", "Leading figure in the dissemination of research findings among BRAC managers and staff. In 2000, BRAC organized dissemination conferences in all the major divisional centers of the country. The participants to these conferences were directors, program coordinators, program managers and area managers. The Research & Evaluation Division selected 5-6 studies for dissemination in the conferences. Each of the study was presented using power-point and was subsequently followed by questions and answers. The conferences were successful due to clear presentations of the research findings and proper answers to all the questions raised in the meetings.", "BRAC was responsible for conducting the local, regional and national level consultation meetings of PRSP. The aim of these consultation workshops was to prepare an interim PRSP document. My task was to facilitate the workshops, take notes and prepare reports. Although the National Consultants, Dr. Binayek Sen and Dr. Mustafa K. Mujeri were present in each of the consultation workshops, I facilitated most of the workshops and took notes. Finally I produced reports on each of the workshops."]}, {"Time Period": "May 1997 \u2013 September 1999", "Organization": "Proshika", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Head of the Policy Research Department", "Responsibilities": ["Supervise a large team of 17 researchers. Coordinate research projects. Liaise with donors. Coordinate and present research programs and activities to Proshika management. Conduct comparative studies, impact assessments, evaluations, baseline surveys, case studies. Represent Proshika in government, NGO and various other forums. Carry out all activities related to Structural Adjustment Participatory Review Initiative (SAPRI). Actively pursue networking activities related to SAPRI. Coordinate with Washington-based DGAP, World Bank, GOB, NGOs and civil society.", "Conducted research on the status of people removed from the Jamuna Bridge area and resettled nearby. Collected data on social, economic and livelihood problems of the people. Also pointed out efforts of the World Bank in providing housing, compensation and economic development of the targeted people.", "Carry regular contacts and discussions with civil society organizations and regular discussions with the government and the World Bank regarding SAPRI. Form the SAPRI with 48 civil society organizations and NGOs. Organize and coordinate consultative workshops throughout the country. Instrumental in forming the SAPRI Steering Committee and the Technical Committee. Initiated the review study on the structural adjustment programs and policies of the World Bank and IMF. Findings of the study were finally released through a national conference in Dhaka.", "Organized studies related to the Urban Livelihood Study. Edited the draft reports before final publication. Contacted consultants to provide inputs and review the draft reports. Organized publication of the reports. Organized in-house discussions and feedbacks from senior staff and peer colleagues."]}, {"Time Period": "January 1994 \u2013 April 1997", "Organization": "Centre for Policy Dialogue (CPD)", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Deputy Director", "Responsibilities": ["Prepare policy papers and conduct research. Publish dialogue reports including dissemination. Supervise research activities on \u201cAn Independent Review of Bangladesh\u2019s Development\u201d.", "Conduct a research on actual account of all major battles of the Liberation War in 1971. Prepare final reports to donors for completed projects. Develop monitoring plans and indicators. Conducted project and program evaluations. Assist project staff in undertaking periodic reviews and baseline surveys. Conduct needs assessment for a number of interventions/projects and proposals. Compile, supervise and edit Annual Report. Coordinate networking activities. Prepare project proposals on thematic issues and areas.", "Main focus of the activities of the organization was Economic development, Education, Health, Orphan sponsorship and disaster mitigation. Major task was to assess each program/project, set new objectives, targets, activities, minimize cost, rationalize staff, etc. Extensive field visits were undertaken and external M&E staff was engaged to assess actual situation. In-depth discussions were held with managers and staff of each program for assessment. Both the assessments were compared and resolved. Program/project documents were re-written with new emphasis, objectives and targets and project activities were arranged on the basis of log-frame. Retrenchment was carried out mostly at the top level and new managers and assistant managers were recruited. Massive indiscipline and chaos were averted. Monitoring was strengthened and a separate M&E unit was eventually established.", "Developed and established a strong M&E unit. M&E was gradually introduced in several projects and programs. From appointment of M&E staff on a temporary basis to appoint staff for longer durations and finally appointment against permanent positions, a separate and independent M&E unit was established.\n\nMonitoring helped to improve project and program implementation by identifying the lapses and gaps and recommended ways of overcoming the weaknesses and failures. Monitoring plan included development of proper and measurable indicators for each project and program to measure progress of program activities.", "Organized the 2004 flood response program in Manikganj district. The flood response program addressed the following: flood damage assessment, people\u2019s requirements, procurement of flood relief materials, delivery of relief materials, liaison with donors, etc. Flood damage assessment was carried out with the help of fresh recruited staff, emphasizing gender, age, income categories of flood victims, actual damages at household/individual level, etc. Challenges faced were resource constraints, pressure from UP Chairmen and members, local elites and political leaders, lack of medical care especially for children, elderly and women, access to toilets, etc. To maintain neutrality, Disaster Relief and Rehabilitation Committees (DRRC) were established along with close liaison with UP, upazila UNO and Police. Organized distribution of food, non-food, medical, shelter, agricultural inputs, etc. Despite a host of problems faced by the flood relief program, it was successful as major external interferences were avoided, selection of beneficiaries was proper and there was no evidence of irregularity in any activity.", "Conducted evaluation of the Mother & Child Healthcare (MCH) project in Rangpur district. Compared MCH project with the MCH project carried out by RDRS in greater Rangpur districts. MCH was overstaffed and there existed no phase-out plan.", "Prepared a number of project proposals and received funds from donors. The first project to receive funds from the European Commission was on disaster risk reduction. The second project also on disaster risk reduction, received funds from the European Commission. The third project received funds from the UNDP through the government was also on disaster risk reduction using a distinct methodology. The fourth project receiving funds from the European Commission was on the rehabilitation of Rohingya refugees in Cox\u2019s Bazar."]}, {"Time Period": "May 2002 \u2013 July 2004", "Organization": "Practical Action Bangladesh", "Location": "Location: Not specified", "Role/Title": "Socio Economist", "Responsibilities": ["Implement activities, results and objectives of the Consensus Building process in charland. Develop dissemination plans and carry out awareness raising activities. Recruit researchers at field-level. Develop regular reporting system. Develop capacity of poor people to access common property resources through Participatory Action Plan Development. Maintain regular correspondence with the HQ in UK and submit reports to DFID. Develop monitoring plans for the various projects of the organization. Conduct impact assessments on projects and interventions.", "Initiated dissemination activities in char areas and Dhaka through individual contacts, group meetings, public seminars and distribution of printed materials and literature. Popular leaflets, phamplets, brochures and booklets were prepared and widely distributed. In order to raise the confidence of the people, the project initiated different activities aiming at increasing income of the people. The project promoted income earning activities in charland. Promoted maize production. Initiated campaign for goat rearing. Provided training to women for tailoring and cloth-stitching. Organized discussions on Participatory Action Plan Development (PAPD). In the final stage, organized PAPD and achieved local-level consensus between the landless and marginal farmers and the powerful landowners on joint cultivation and use of water-body in the area.", "Responsible for evaluating and developing the regional networks for development of Small & Medium Enterprises (SME). The network helped to unite the local NGOs to build their capacity and develop small business.", "Contributed in implementing activities, results and objectives of the project \u201cEnhancing Food Production in Greater Faridpur district\u201d. Collected and assessed reports from the staff in-charge of production centers in different production points of the project in greater Faridpur district. Based on these written reports, organized systematic field visits and conducted extensive discussions and interviews with project staff, beneficiaries, officials of related government agencies and the people. Emphasized participation and use of simple and innovative technology. Prepared a simple but elaborate monitoring plan for the project. Within a short-time the project was able to achieve most of the targets of the project."]}, {"Time Period": "July 2008", "Organization": "European Commission", "Location": "Location: Not specified", "Role/Title": "Not specified", "Responsibilities": ["Prepared a proposal on \u201cFood Security for Ultra Poor Households headed by Women in Vulnerable Areas of North-West Bangladesh\u201d for the European Commission and received funds."]}]}, "Poverty": {"work_experience": [{"Time Period": "October 2011 to Present", "Organization": "Development Consultant & Global Compliance Initiative (DCGCI)", "Location": "Not specified", "Role/Title": "Director", "Responsibilities": ["Conduct research, baseline survey, impact analysis on adolescent reproductive health, disaster risk reduction. It also entails drafting of a national solid waste management policy and strategy, regulations, guidelines, and standards. - Tasks involved:   * Lead a multi-disciplinary team to build the capacity of waste management in Nepal * Assess institutional, financial, legal and social aspects of waste management in Nepal * Review of Policies, Acts, Rules and Strategies pertaining to solid and medical waste management, identify gaps, and recommend ways to strengthen the policy regime * Contribute to and supervise institutional diagnostic exercises * Prepare inception report and other documentation"}, {"Project Name": "Urban Public and Environmental Health Sector Development Project", "Time Period": "2012", "Client/Organization": "Commitment Consultants/Asian Development Bank", "Location": "Bangladesh", "Description": "- The project\u2019s objective was to improve public and environmental health conditions in urban areas of Bangladesh. It particularly attempted to improve the health status of poor communities to improve child and maternal health care, reduce communicable diseases and improve urban sanitation. - * Review the proposed system for solid and medical waste collection, transfer, and disposal; food and water safety and hygiene; supervise implementation. * Review existing policies and programs for urban public and environmental health to prepare and promulgate relevant national policy frameworks and guidelines."}, {"Project Name": "Urban Primary Health Care Sector Development Program", "Time Period": "2010", "Client/Organization": "Asian Development Bank", "Location": "Bangladesh", "Description": "- This project was an upstream work to support a large investment project to improve solid waste management services in six large cities in Bangladesh including healthcare (medical) waste. It entailed review of policies, analysis of existing situation, technical advice for landfills and small transfer stations, operational guidelines, sample bid documents, private sector participation, institutional development, and human resource development. - Tasks involved:   * Reviewed Policies, Acts, Rules and Strategies pertaining to solid and medical waste management, identified gaps, and recommended ways to strengthen the policy regime; * Prepared Sample Bid Documents to assist city corporations; * Contribute to performance monitoring and management improvement * Prepared Guidelines to implement Acts and Rules; * Conducted Institutional Review of city corporations to enhance better SWM service delivery; * Conducted Workshops with stakeholders to disseminate findings and build consensus to improve SWM services."}, {"Project Name": "Assessment of Solid Waste Management in the Maldives", "Time Period": "2006-2007", "Client/Organization": "Water & Sanitation Program, World Bank", "Location": "Maldives", "Description": "- This was part of a reconstruction project in the Maldives. The work involved assessment of existing solid waste management service in various atolls of the Maldives, identification of gaps, and providing advice to improve service level. - Tasks involved:   * Conduct assessment of existing solid waste management practices including community engagement aspects * Identify gaps and suggest improvement for better solid waste management service"}, {"Project Name": "Public-Private-Community partnership for solid waste management", "Time Period": "2000-2003", "Client/Organization": "Water & Sanitation Program, World Bank", "Location": "Bangladesh", "Description": "- This was a pioneer project to forge a public-private-community partnership for solid waste management in Khulna City, Bangladesh. This pilot has now expanded to serve the entire city with about 1.5 million population. This successful model has been replicated in many cities. - Designed and implemented a public-private-community partnership business model for solid waste management in Khulna city, Bangladesh."}, fields.expertise_details:
{"Higher Education Administration": {"work_experience": "January 2009-present—Vice-President for Student Access & Success
Provides leadership for the Division of Student Access & Success.
Major Accomplishments:
1. Secured SACSCOC approval to offer the first competency-based baccalaureate degree offered by a public institution, 2013.
2. Achieved enrollment milestones in 2009-2012. 3. Achieved student persistence and graduation rate goals, 2010-2013. 4. Implemented processes to improve first-year, first-time freshmen retention. 5. Created the concept for the Division of Student Access and Success and led staff in the design of a one-stop shop for student enrollment services.
6. Created the University College, which focuses on college readiness and student success of first-year students.
7. Redesigned Student Affairs Division to focus on campus life and student development.

May 2007-December 2008-- Interim Provost and Vice-President for Academic & Student Affairs
Served as chief academic officer, as well as responsible for enrollment management and student affairs. Also assumed duties and responsibilities of the AVP/Dean of Enrollment Management and Retention from June 1-November 15.
Major Accomplishments:
1. Student enrollment increase of 7.21 percent from Fall 2006 to Fall 2007. 2. 3. Provided salary increases for all recruiters so they are competitive with peer institutions. 4. Provided increases for adjuncts in the College of Arts and Sciences and College of Education and Human Services.
Implemented Honors College.
5. Addressed tenure and promotion issues with specific strategies to be reviewed by and input solicited from the university community.
6. Developed a Frequently Asked Questions document and website for the university community to assist students.
7. Awarded financial aid and scholarships 10 days prior to classes. 8. Established financial aid temporary help desk. 9. Facilitated development of strategic plan for the division. 10. Improved processes in financial aid and tightened satisfactory academic progress procedure. 11. Facilitated hiring the university’s first full-time grants writer to assist faculty with proposals to state and federal agencies.
12. Required all first-year students to enroll in a First-Year Success Seminar and implemented early intervention processes.
13. Developed faculty development plan that addresses the eventual establishment of a Teaching/Learning Center.
14. Implemented a department heads training program. 15. Implemented Quality Enhancement Plan Team and provided training.

2004-May 2007 Associate Vice-President for Academic and Student Affairs
Assists the Provost and Vice President for Academic and Student Affairs in planning, developing, and achieving academic and student support goals.
Major Accomplishments:
1. Submitted proposals and received approval from the A&M System and Coordinating Board to offer Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Sciences in Liberal Studies, Bachelor of Science in Human Performance, Bachelor of Science in Sport and Recreation Administration, and Bachelor of Science in Health Promotion.
2. Prepared and submitted proposal resulting in the Navarro College Partnership’s receiving the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board’s Star Award.
3. Facilitated the establishment of the Navarro College Midlothian campus. 4. Facilitated the establishment of Project STEEM. 5. Facilitated the establishment of the Honors College.

2002 – 2004 Commerce
Interim Associate Vice-President for Academic Affairs, Texas A&M University-
Major Accomplishments:
1. Developed and submitted A&M University-Commerce’s Institutional Plan for Distance Learning. The university’s plan was cited as exemplary by the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board and is posted as a model on their website: http://www.thecb.state.tx.us/DistanceEd/exemplary.HTM
2. Provided assistance in the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools (SACS) Accreditation process resulting in reaffirmation of accreditation.
3. Submitted proposals and received approval from the A&M System and Coordinating Board to offer the Bachelor of Applied Arts and Science, Bachelor of Wildlife and Conservation Science, Master of Science in Management (online), Master of Education in Elementary Education at Rockwall, Master of Finance, and Master of Social Work at Mesquite.
4. Facilitated the development of an online career advising site linking majors to career opportunities. 5. Prepared and submitted proposal that resulted in Mayo College receiving recognition as a finalist in the Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board’s Star Award Program.
6. Facilitated the establishment of the Rockwall Higher Education Partnership by ensuring active participation of institutional effectiveness, enrollment management, and academic and student support services in the process.", "projects": null, "other_related_info": "Skills Mentioned: Strategic Planning, Enrollment Management, Student Success, Faculty Development, Program Evaluation, Community Development
Certifications: None specified
Education/Training: Ph.D. in Educational Psychology, M.Ed. in Counseling and Guidance, B.S. in Vocational-Technical Education and Business
Tools & Software: None specified
Achievements: Secured SACSCOC approval for competency-based baccalaureate degree, Achieved enrollment milestones, Improved student retention and graduation rates, Created University College, Redesigned Student Affairs Division
Publications: Several publications on higher education, distance learning, and curriculum development
Professional Associations: Association for Psychological Science
Languages: None specified"}, "Distance Learning": {}, "Curriculum Development": {}, "Grant Writing": {}, "Leadership Development": {}, "Educational Technology": {}, "Student Affairs": {}, "Instructional Design": {}}

{"Software Engineering": {"work_experience": "Time Period: August 2024 - PRESENT
Organization: Maxwell Stamp LTD
Location: Gulshan-2, Bangladesh
Role/Title: Software/AI Engineer
Responsibilities:
- Design, develop, and maintain software applications based on client requirements.
- Pursuit govt projects and provide the expertise as per requirement.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze requirements.
- Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members.
- Research and implement machine learning algorithms and models to solve specific client problems.
- Build and optimize AI models for tasks such as predictive analytics, natural language processing, and computer vision.
- Monitor and evaluate the performance of AI solutions, making necessary adjustments as needed.
- Participate in client meetings to understand project scope and objectives.
- Communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
- Provide ongoing support and training to clients on software and AI solutions.
- Work closely with other professionals to ensure cohesive project development.
- Contribute to a collaborative team environment by sharing knowledge and assisting team members.", "projects": "Project Name: AI-Powered CV Parser
Time Period: June 2025-Present
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- Resume Parser Portable is a comprehensive, AI-powered resume analysis application designed to streamline the recruitment process.
- This application provides recruiters and HR professionals with advanced tools to parse, analyze, and manage candidate resumes efficiently.
- The application runs as a portable executable with an integrated web interface, making it easy to deploy without complex installation requirements.
- Features: AI Resume Parsing, AI Job Matching, Google Drive Integration, Modern Web Interface, Candidate Database Management, Advanced Search and Filtering
- Technology: Django, Next Js, Mongo DB, Open AI API

Project Name: Bengali Marketing Spare Management System
Time Period: November 2024-Present
Client/Organization: Coca-Cola fridge repair company
Description:
- A full-stack inventory management system for a Coca-Cola fridge repair company.
- The solution provides both an admin portal for spare-parts catalog and stock control, and a technician portal for logging, tracking, and updating repair jobs.
- It also includes real-time dashboards and daily consumption reports showing exactly which spares each technician used.
- Features: Admin Portal, Technician Portal, Real-Time Tracking, Consumption Reporting, Role-Based Access
- Technology: React Js, Nest Js, Prisma ORM, PortgresSQL,Vercel (Deployment)

Project Name: ERP Solution
Time Period: November 2024- Present
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- This ERP system features robust inventory management capabilities, enabling efficient tracking of inventory levels, orders, sales, and deliveries.
- It also includes a comprehensive Human Resources (HR) module to manage employee data, payroll, recruitment, and performance.
- The solution is a cloud-based, ensuring scalability, speed, and flexibility to support organizational growth and efficiency.
- Technologies Used: Django ninja, Tailwind CSS, Next.js, postgresSQL, Digital Ocean

Project Name: QueryMind
Time Period: December 2024- Present
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- Specialized Search Tool to find relevant documents on a local server
- Features: User profiles, service categorization, technician ratings and reviews, appointment scheduling, and in-app messaging.
- Technologies Used: Natural Language Processing,Document Type Filtering,Pre-Indexed for Speed, AI-Generated Metadata, Advanced Search Algorithms, Efficient Document Retrieval

Project Name: TrackEasy
Time Period: Not specified
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- TrackEasy is a task management application designed to enhance personal and professional productivity.
- Users can create, manage, and track tasks efficiently, enabling better time management and organization.
- Features: Task creation and categorization, deadline setting, priority management, progress tracking, and user-friendly interface.
- Technologies Used: React, Tailwind CSS, Next.js, and Firebase.

Project Name: MISTRI
Time Period: Not specified
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- MISTRI is an innovative platform that connects customers with technicians for household maintenance services.
- It simplifies the process of finding qualified technicians and scheduling maintenance work.
- Features: User profiles, service categorization, technician ratings and reviews, appointment scheduling, and in-app messaging.
- Technologies Used: Next JS, React, Sanity CMS, Hasura, and RESTful APIs, Tailwind CSS

Project Name: Criczy
Time Period: Not specified
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- Criczy is a cricket score prediction application that utilizes machine learning algorithms to analyze player statistics and match conditions, providing users with accurate predictions for upcoming matches.
- Features: Match prediction, player performance analysis, historical data visualization, and user engagement features.
- Technologies Used: Python, Pandas, Numpy, Streamlit.

Project Name: Tic-Tac-Toe CSP
Time Period: Not specified
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- This project presents an AI solution for the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game, employing constraint satisfaction techniques to optimize gameplay strategies.
- It demonstrates the application of AI in solving combinatorial problems.
- Features: Interactive gameplay, AI opponent with varying difficulty levels, and a user-friendly interface.
- Technologies Used: Python and custom AI algorithms.

Project Name: Book Recommender System
Time Period: Not specified
Client/Organization: Not specified
Description:
- The Book Recommender System is a collaborative filtering-based tool that provides personalized book suggestions to users based on their reading history and preferences.
- Features: Recommendation engine

{"Survey Design": {"work_experience": "From: 1995
Employer: UNICEF
Positions held: Advisor/survey Manager in Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) related to children and women
To: 2010

From: 2005
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Various positions including: i) Consultant in Situation of ethnic minority children and women ii) Principal Investigator in Follow-up survey for Livelihood Skill and Life Skill Based Education for HTR Graduates in Three Metropolitan Cities iii) Principal Investigator in Monitor the distributed blended foods in six flood-affected districts
To: 2005

From: 2008
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Baseline survey on Health and Nutrition assessment in SIDR affected area of Bangladesh
To: 2008

From: 2007
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Baseline Survey for Measuring the Impact of Anaemia Prevention Interventions on Anaemia in Children, Adolescent girls and Women in the Chittagong Hill Tracts (CHT)
To: 2007

From: 2007
Employer: PLAN- Bangladesh
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Managed Health Care Project in Selected Areas of Bangladesh
To: 2007

From: 2006
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Baseline study of empowerment of adolescent girls (Kishori Abhijan) project
To: 2007

From: 2006
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Baseline and End line Survey for Measuring the Impact of Micronutrient Fortified Biscuits on the Nutritional Status of Pre-School Children
To: 2007

From: 2006
Employer: PLAN- Bangladesh
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Community Managed Health Care Project in Dhaka City
To: 2006

From: 2006
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Principal Investigator in Pre-testing of communication materials on prevention of bird flu project
To: 2006

From: 1993
Employer: Bangladesh Bureau of statistics/UNICEF.
Positions held: National Coordinator/ Principal Investigator in Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey
To: 2003

From: 1997
Employer: UNICEF/ DGHS
Positions held: Consultant in Baseline Survey for ORT Communication Campaign in Whole Bangladesh
To: 1997

From: 1992
Employer: UNICEF-Dhaka
Positions held: Various positions including: i) Consultant in Survey on Child Survival and Development Indicators in Whole Bangladesh ii) Consultant in Survey on Selected Child Survival and Development indicators at national and divisional levels iii) Consultant in Survey on Child Mortality in whole Bangladesh
To: 1993", "projects": "Name of assignment or project: Follow-up survey for Livelihood Skill and Life Skill Based Education for HTR Graduates in Three Metropolitan Cities
Year: 2005
Location: Bangladesh
Client: UNICEF-Dhaka
Main project features:
i) With the assistance from UNICEF’s pilot project ‘Livelihood Skill Development Project (LSDP) for hard to reach children Dhaka Ahsania Mission (DAM), for Rural Development (VARD) and Voluntary Organization for Social Development (VOSD) provided livelihood skill development training to some 920 HTR children in Dhaka, Barisal, and Sylhet cities in 2005. This study was done by SURCH to assess the level of skills, achievement of training goals, utilization of training in getting better jobs and life skill development of the HTR graduates.
ii) From the lists of HTR graduates of the above three implementing NGOs, 54 Percent of the graduate children (500) and 13 percent of the guardians (124) were selected as sample respondents of the study by systematic random sampling method.
iii) Both quantitative and qualitative methods (case study and in-depth interview with project staff and employers) of data collection were used.
Positions held: Principal Investigator
Activities performed:
i) Designing of the sample and methodology of the study.
ii) Providing professional and technical guidance and instructions to the officers of SURCH for selecting samples.
iii) Developing questionnaires and other study tools.
iv) Providing professional and technical guidance and instructions for conducting training of field staff and implementing the field works.

Name of assignment or project: Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) related to children and women
Year: 1995-2010
Location: Iraq, Cambodia, Korea, Bhutan, South Sudan, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Turkmenistan, Vanuatu
Client: UNICEF
Main project features: National and sub national level survey
Positions held: Advisor/survey Manager
Activities performed: Conducted sample design, questionnaire development and data processing/analysis on Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) and other national data sources related to children and women.

Name of assignment or project: Baseline study of empowerment of adolescent girls (Kishori Abhijan) project
Year: 2006-2007
Location: Bangladesh
Client: UNICEF-Dhaka /Johns Hopkins University
Main project features: As the K.A project is being implemented in 27 districts across 6 divisions, the sampling was designed to be representative with respect to the districts. Two stage sampling procedure was utilized; in the first stage sample centres/associations and in the second stage, sample adolescents were selected by using systematic random sampling procedures.
Positions held: Principal Investigator
Activities performed:
i) Making sample design and developing survey methodology.
ii) Providing professional and technical guidance and instructions to SURCH officers in selecting samples, instrument development, and training of field workers, field management and quality assurance, data analysis and writing the report.

Name of assignment or project: Behavioural monitoring plan of key participants of the Kishori Abhijan Project
Year: 2008-2010
Location: Bangladesh
Client: UNICEF-Dhaka
Main project features:
i) SURCH with technical support of Johns Hopkins University, USA is monitoring the adolescents, parents and community Influential through the Kishori Abhijan Project of the two partner NGOs, BRAC and CMES. Out of the total 5 rounds monitoring data collection, the behavioural change of analysis and reporting in a period of two and a half years, 4 rounds have already been done. An indicator matrix with 20 monitoring indicators was developed through doing and learning process.
ii) Monitoring sample included 12 sites/centres of BRAC and 12 sites/associations of CMES selected by systematic random sampling method from the list of sample sites of the baseline survey.
Positions held: Consultant
Activities performed: As co-researcher provided professional inputs all through the study from designing methodology; developing indicator matrix and indicators; developing checklists; analysis of data and information; and report preparation with due sharing with the chief consultant, Dr. Sood Suruchi of Johns Hopkins University.

Name of assignment or project: Prevention of child injury through social-intervention and education Project
Year: 2008
Location: Bangladesh
Client: UNICEF-Dhaka
Main project features:
i) The PRECISE project, new of its kind in Bangladesh, aimed to prevent child injury due to road traffic accident, drowning, burn, and poisoning the intervention areas through Anchal program (Community safety program), Swim safe program, Home safe program, School safe program and community mobilization and Behaviour change communication program. SURCH evaluated the performance of those programs and overall impact of the project in prevention or reducing child injuries in the intervention areas. Comparison was made between the intervention areas and the corresponding control areas. Both quantitative (Household survey) and qualitative (FGD, Observation of Anchal and swim centre) methods of data collection were conducted. A two stage stratified cluster sampling design was implemented for the household survey.
ii) Economic analysis for running an Anchal and a swim centre was made so that it can help in replicating the project.
Positions held: Consultant
Activities performed:
i) Designing study methodology including sample design
ii) Developing study instruments
iii) Data analysis and preparing report
iv) Overall guidance and instruction

Name of assignment or project: Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey
Year: 1993-2003
Location: Bangladesh
Client: Bangladesh Bureau of statistics/UNICEF
Main project features:
i) For monitoring the progress of achievement of the national goals on the wellbeing of children and women as identified in the world Summit Declaration, Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics in collaboration with UNICEF, UN Statistics Division and ISRT, Dhaka University developed a statistically sound rapid survey technique, Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) in 1993 and carried out the survey in 64 districts.
ii) SURCH provided technical assistance to BBS in implementing the MICSs.
Positions held: National coordinator/principal investigator
Activities performed: Provided professional inputs in designing MICS sample design.

Name of assignment or project: Baseline Survey for ORT Communication Campaign in Whole Bangladesh
Year: 1997
Location: Bangladesh
Client: UNICEF/ DGHS
Main project features: Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) system first introduced by Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS) was followed, which was a two stage cluster sampling consisting of 13 clusters in each of the 64 rural districts and 13 urban domain with roughly 650 households per cluster. In the Baseline Survey, however, the number of clusters and number of households per cluster were increased to 16 and 800 respectively for 16 rural districts and 3 urban domains. Thus the total sample size was 55,000 households.
Positions held: Consultant
Activities performed:
i) Adaptation of MICS design with slight modification.
ii) Provided guidance for selection of households and the three categories of respondents.
iii) Data were collected by 8 different agencies/organizations including SURCH. SURCH conducted training sessions for trainers and field workers of those agencies/organization. {"Leasing": {"work_experience": "From: 2006
To: 2009
Employer: Devco Capital, a subsidiary of RM Asia (Thailand, Cambodia and Lao PDR)
Position held: Consultant
Responsibilities:
- Establish the first leasing and equipment finance company in Cambodia and Lao
- Developed and implemented business plan that included the first ever vehicle and equipment leasing and financing in Cambodia, then Lao PDR
- Evaluated other courtiers as expansion possibilities
- Wrote all legal documentation, accounting and tax systems, operating procedures and process flows
- Hired, trained and managed staff of various nationalities and cultures
- Oversaw day-to-day sales, lease processing, accounting, and administration
- Developed and conducted sales training programs for affiliated organizations
- Negotiated leases with firms including multi-nationals, NGO’s, and sole proprietors

From: 1979
To: 1994
Employer: RSN Equipment Leasing
Position held: Founder and President
Responsibilities:
- [Responsibilities not specified]

From: 1976
To: 1979
Employer: WW Leasing Unlimited
Position held: Sales Consultant
Responsibilities:
- [Responsibilities not specified]", "projects": "Name of assignment or project: TA on Financial Leasing
Year: 2006
Location: Cambodia
Client: Ministry of Economics and Finance including the Tax Department
Main project features: Increase awareness and understanding of leasing
Position held: Speaker – Vendor Oriented Lessor
Activities performed: Presentation on potential issues, solutions, and areas of financial leasing that affect multiple ministries and organizations including Ministry of Commerce, Ministry of Industry and Mines, Ministry of Economics and Finance including the Tax Department, National Bank of Cambodia and ADB.

Name of assignment or project: Lease Registration Symposium
Year: 2010
Location: Beijing, China
Client: IFC
Main project features: International lease Symposium
Position held: Speaker
Activities performed: Speaker to provide an international perspective on lease registration systems in other countries and why one is necessary in China. Explained the need for registration of the ownership of leased assets Provided examples of potential problem situations

Name of assignment or project: Understanding Leasing Seminar
Year: 2009
Location: Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Client: ACLEDA Bank
Main project features: Three day seminar covering all aspects of leasing for twenty-seven top managers plus two representatives of the National Bank of Cambodia
Position held: Project leader and Instructor.
Activities performed: Objectives of the seminar: Anticipate day-to-day leasing problems and dilemmas. Enlighten the team on overall spectrum and interwoven principles of “leasing.” Lead the team through developing a leasing product.

Name of assignment or project: Banker Training on Secured Transactions
Year: 2009
Location: Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Client: IFC
Main project features: Survey of existing industry policies and practices, review of international best practices, and education of banks on existing methods of doing business compared to the possible future products that could be offered
Position held: Consultant / Instructor
Activities performed: Analysed the Law on Secured Transactions and illustrated concepts with real-life situations. Reviewed current systems and the ones that are missing in Cambodia to realize on the collateral that is pledged. Showed the steps to file a perfecting notice with the Ministry of Commerce. Tools & Software: [Not specified]
Achievements: Served on the Board of Directors of United Association of Equipment Lessors (UAEL); Participated in two 5-year planning taskforces; Served as an expert witness on leasing; Initiated the Certification process for UAEL
Publications: Contributing editor - Certified Lease Professional Handbook
Professional Associations: United Association of Equipment Lessors (UAEL)

fields.expertise_details:
{"Social Protection": {"work_experience": "Time Period: 2013-Present
Organization: Self-Employed
Location: Bangladesh
Role/Title: Independent Consultant
Responsibilities:
- Regularly providing consultancy services to local organisations and NGOs in writing proposals, EoI with special focus on health, nutrition and population related issues.

Time Period: 2007-2013
Organization: USAID/Chemonics International
Location: Bangladesh
Role/Title: Senior Policy Advisor, Bangladesh Smiling Sun Franchise Programme (SSFP)
Responsibilities:
- Identified policy needs and developed a plan for policy activities during the annual strategic and planning exercise.
- Supervised fund allocated/disbursed to the local 27 NGOs who provided essential service delivery programme (maternal health, family planning, antenatal and neo-natal care, etc.).
- Provided leadership in the corruption cross-cutting filter.
- Led in implementing the health franchise policy agenda.
- All coordination activities with the related Ministries (MoHFW, CHT Affairs, Ministry and Local Government Division), DGHS, DGFP, and IMED.
- Prepared Smiling Sun Health Services (SSHS) Policy, SSFP Ethical Guideline and Advocacy Strategy.
- Supervised fundraising activities.
- Ensured basic services on maternal, child, and other basic health services in areas served by SSFP, with an emphasis on serving the poor and on improving the sustainability of local NGOs in continuing to provide these services.
- Designed specifications and systems for all database and monitoring and evaluation tools to be integrated into the performance monitoring system.
- Developed and implemented a comprehensive communication strategy for the project, captured and disseminated project success stories.
- Maintained liaison with stakeholders relating to implementation of the programme and worked as acting CoP in absence of CoP.

Time Period: 2005-2006
Organization: Planning Wing, MoHFW, GoB
Location: Bangladesh
Role/Title: Joint Chief
Responsibilities:
- Worked on social protection programmes, particularly maternal vouchers.
- under HNPSP, MoHFW, introduced Demand-Side Financing (DSF), i.e., Voucher Scheme for poor pregnant women on pilot basis. Fully involved in its design and beneficiaries targeting.

Time Period: 2006-2007
Organization: Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Unit, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), GoB/ GIZ
Location: Bangladesh
Role/Title: Senior Policy Advisor
Responsibilities:
- Identified capacity development and external assistance needs for the M&E unit and co-ordinated TA support received from the donors.
- Guided the M&E unit members on policy matters.
- Assisted in the development of the health sector programme monitoring work plan.
- Worked to strengthen the position of the M&E unit within the MoHFW through the development of the M&E unit mid-term strategy.
- Facilitated close collaboration between the MoHFW M&E unit, GTZ, other M&E support organisations, agencies, and development partners.
- Co-ordinated and encouraged regular dialogue with M&E task group, relevant organisations, the Planning Commission, the IMED, NGOs, and stakeholders relevant to M&E of the HNPSP.

- To ensure value chain approaches by networking & private sector engagement in agricultural production, marketing and business development.
- Implementing farm, non-farm & market product activities.
- Monitoring and Supervising of staffs in Business Development.
- Prepare & develop training module, handout paper, and facilitation documents, planning for the sessions, training materials, leaflets on different sustainable economic development issues for capacity building of staffs, farmers, plant & vegetable production nursery growers and other stakeholders as per need. 
- Policy making, planning, designing, preparing the budget for economic development of beneficiaries by Agriculture, Forestry, Aquaculture and Livestock program.
- To establish homestead plant nursery (timber, fruit, medicinal plants and shade tree for tea garden) for seedling production by the farmers community in the village.
- Seed production, supervision, sales, marketing and agricultural value chain development.
- Develop program design to create sustainable livelihood to the targeted households which contributes for child wellbeing.
- To publish a quarterly agriculture based Newsletter named “McBarta” for sharing and developing the knowledge in Farmers level.
- Implement support to the poor widow, poor and marginal farmers, such as – Shallow Machine for Watering, Tractor for ploughing, Milking Cow, Goat, Hens, Ducks, Sewing Machine for clothing etc.
- To provide different types of educational scholarship, such as – General School Students Competition and McFarmer’s School including the meritorious children of employees.
- Interact, build and nurture effective working relationships & networking with relevant internal and external organizations in order to foster coordination, collaboration and partnership.
- To prepare reports, formulate positions on issues, articulate options concisely conveying maximum necessary information. 
- Policy making on different crop production issues considering environmental protection and to arrange seminar, workshop on different issues and represent the issue.
- Monitoring & Evaluation of the entire program.
- To provide information, guidance and technical advice with regard to the Organization’s resources requirements and perform other duties as required and to analyze the situation, case studies and synthesis reports.
- Annual budget preparation and analysis.
- Report writing on program to the Vice President and Managing Director."}, {"Time Period": "From: February 18, 2004, To: May 28, 2007 (3 Year 3 Month 9 Days)", "Organization": "Bangladesh Rural Advancement Committee (BRAC),  NGO, Afghanistan", "Location": "Afghanistan Country Office, Kabul (2 years) & BRAC Regional Office (Project Site, 1 year), Quchi Sarwal (Adjacent to WFP Area Office), Mazar –I- Sharif, Balkh, Afghanistan", "Role/Title": "Forest & Environment Specialist, (PIN: 53345)", "Responsibilities": "- Develop livelihoods, value chain in economic development program specially on horticulture and poverty reduction issues and monitor to the trends in the field of market development and value chain.
- To prepare and develop project proposal and training module, training materials, leaflets on the program of Agriculture, Forestry, Horticulture, Livestock, and Environmental Protection including Climate Change issues.
- Planning, designing, and preparing budget for a Central Horticulture Nursery and Green House for producing large number of seedlings and to increase the flori-horticultural production.
- Supervising National and International Staffs.
- To maintain liaison with UNDP, WFP, FAO, GAIN, UNICEF, UNESCO, DCA-VET, DACAAR, Government & others.
- To develop food distribution plan for Wheat, Pulse, Oil, Salt, Maize and policy making for distribution of vegetable seeds & seeds of horticultural plants to the farmers and beneficiaries for increasing IGA by the program of Kitchen gardening, orchard management, cage layer rearing and livestock including artificial insemination for the sustainable development.
- Develop program design to create sustainable livelihood to the targeted households which contributes for child wellbeing.
- Policy making on project management, team building & mobilization, environmental protection, planning, designing, preparing the budget.
- Warehouse management.
- To conduct independent research analysis, identifying issues, formulating options and making conclusion, evaluation and recommendation. 
- To prepare reports, formulate positions on issues, articulate options concisely conveying maximum necessary information.
- To provide information, guidance and technical advice with regard to the Organization’s resources requirements and perform other duties as required and to analyze the situation, case studies and synthesis reports.

- To establish and maintain effective working relations with the people of different national and cultural backgrounds with sensitivity and respect of diversity.

- Develop research in economic development and poverty reduction issues and approaches to market development and value chain.
- Social mobilization and community development.
- Develop program design to create sustainable livelihood to the targeted beneficiaries.
- To implement the field level activities under Environmental Awareness and Monitoring at Grassroots Level Project.
- To maintain liaison & linkages with UNDP, WFP and coordination with NGOs, Civil Society, Government & other stakeholders.
- To assist the environmental watch /Social Watch Committee at Thana level strengthening their capacity building.
- General people mobilization, School and college students orientation on environmental issues, such as – air pollution, noise pollution, water pollution, deforestation, illegal smoke of brick field, illegal hill cutting in hilly area, bird hunting and extinction of birds & wildlife.
- To conduct press release, seminar and symposium on Human Right Issues (such as – rape, acid throwing, murder etc.), Women Rights Day, World Human Rights Day, World Environment Day, and world AIDS day etc.
- To implement advocacy about women’s empowerment & analyze the situation including case studies and synthesis reports.
